Illegal crosses in French public spaces reignite debates over church-state separation
subhead: Calvaries installed on public land in towns in the Alps, on the Mediterranean coast and on the island of Corsica, sometimes with the help of far-right identitarian movements, have rekindled long-standing tensions around France's 1905 law separating churches and state.

title: Cambodia retaliates against Thailand after air strikes kill civilians and trigger mass evacuations
subhead: The renewed hostilities, after months of sporadic skirmishes and a stalled ceasefire deal, have escalated a century-old territorial dispute and deepened fears of a wider conflict in the region.

title: Exiled Venezuelan opposition rallies in support of Nobel winner Machado: 'The regime's days are numbered, and we are ready to return'
subhead: In Madrid and in dozens of cities around the world, opposition figures demonstrated unity as the Nobel Prize is set to be awarded to their leader on December 10 in Oslo, convinced that the collapse of Nicolás Maduro's regime is imminent.

title: Russia refuses to yield after 11 years of failed peace negotiations on Ukraine
subhead: Since the war began in 2014, every attempt at negotiation to end the conflict has failed, with Moscow violating every agreement. Today, with Europe sidelined and the Americans aligning with Russia's views, Vladimir Putin is convinced he holds the upper hand.

The incomplete transformation of Syria's Ahmed al-Sharaa, Islamist rebel turned president
subhead: 'Syria after Assad' (1/4). The man who toppled Syria's Baathist regime has succeeded in breaking the country's international isolation. Yet the former jihadist, who governs with a handful of loyal followers, has struggled to defuse the sectarian and ethnic tensions left by the civil war.

title: Syria's last embroiderers: 'I lost my home and my fields, but I always kept this bag'
subhead: A symbol of the country's diversity, Syrian embroidery nearly disappeared during the 13 years of civil war. Since the fall of Bashar al-Assad in late 2024, a group of women led by a German woman in her 70s has been trying to keep this age-old art alive.

title: France's budget, a crucial task in mostly male hands
subhead: The two finance committees are the most male-dominated in the entire French Parliament. Neither has ever been chaired by a woman.
